comment: Very drinkable on a few rocks.
Great distillery and a nice smooth taste to the whiskey. Not too woody.
Nice spice , nice heat. Kosher and organic.
Flat and bland. Not worth the price.
Light nose and good flavor... especially since I'm not a big fan of Ryes
Had a few different ones from Catoctin at Moonlight mile – but don't think this was one

Tasted it at an American Distillers function in Johannesburg, and managed ti keep the bottle for our bar. Hugely impressed, plenty happening here, complex, opens up very pleasantly with a drop of water.
Met Scott at Liquor Box in Greenpoint
Sampler from Flaviar. Solid rye, vanilla sweet and piney with a warm and woody, medium finish. Quite a bit of alcohol burn. For the price, would probably just go with michter's instead.

I've visited Catoctin Creek and found them to be enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and I have high hopes for them.  But at the time we visited (2014), their spirits were still aged for a fairly short time, and it showed--lots of new spirit burn and a particular burn on the nose.  It does have rich, syrup-y flavors with some pepperiness that shows promise, so I look forward to older aged versions of their products.

Barrel #489 Pine Orchard Staff Pick; 100 proof version, herbal and brown sugar nose, nice dried fruit entry with kicking herbal and spice notes late; long flavorful finish with sweetness returning at end before turning back to herbal notes.
My go to for rye whiskey
There’s a sweetness to this that reminds of corn. Typical rye spiciness is restrained here. Smooth and drinkable. Always an enjoyable visit to the distillery too!
Very smooth with a buttery finish
Definitely a lighter rye. Less spicy finishing notes.
